summary: This is a series of email exchanges from August 27, 2021, regarding the saving of notes and scanned documents to specific folders (3500 and witness folders) on an 'Epstein share'. The emails involve a contractor, an FBI agent, and an NYPD detective assigned to the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.context: A contractor is involved in the email chain, receiving and sending requests to save notes and documents to the 'Epstein share' folders.

persons.name: Detective NYPD
persons.role: NYPD Detective / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: An NYPD detective assigned to the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force is part of the email chain, involved in the request to save notes.

connections.description: They are communicating via email regarding the handling of case-related notes and documents for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Epstein case notes
events.description: A series of emails were exchanged to coordinate the saving of notes and a scanned document to specific folders (3500 and witness folders) on an 'Epstein share'.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from August 27, 2021, showing ongoing administrative activity related to the Epstein case.
It references an 'Epstein share' with specific folders named '3500' and 'witness folders', indicating organized digital storage for case materials.
The correspondence involves a contractor and an NYPD detective assigned to the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
A document was scanned and sent from a Xerox multifunction printer located at 290 Broadway in New York, a known federal building.
The subject matter is the handling of 'notes', suggesting these are investigative notes or evidence related to the Epstein case.
